text: Tiglath-Pileser II (from the Hebraic form Spelled as "" "Tiglath-Pileser" in the Books of Kings () or as "" "Tilgath-Pilneser" in the Books of Chronicles (). of Akkadian Tukultī-apil-Ešarra) was King of Assyria from 967 BCE, when he succeeded his father Ashur-resh-ishi II, until his death in 935 BCE, when he was succeeded by his son Ashur-dan II. Little is known about his reign. ==See also== *Tiglath-Pileser I *Tiglath-Pileser III ==Footnotes== ==References== * Category:935 BC deaths Category:10th-century BC Assyrian kings Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Tiglath-Pileser II
